intro: Veronica simpsonii, commonly known as Simpson's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seed capsules that disperse its seeds by wind. Simpson's speedwell is often found in alpine and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
